Detailed Description

An implementation of the backend in ../QuEST_internal.h for a GPU environment.

Author
Ania Brown
Tyson Jones

◆ agnostic_createDiagonalOp()

DiagonalOp agnostic_createDiagonalOp ( int  numQubits,
QuESTEnv  env 
)

Definition at line 331 of file QuEST_gpu.cu.

331 {
332
333 DiagonalOp op;
334 op.numQubits = numQubits;
335 op.numElemsPerChunk = (1LL << numQubits) / env.numRanks;
336 op.chunkId = env.rank;
337 op.numChunks = env.numRanks;
338
339 // allocate CPU memory (initialised to zero)
340 op.real = (qreal*) calloc(op.numElemsPerChunk, sizeof(qreal));
341 op.imag = (qreal*) calloc(op.numElemsPerChunk, sizeof(qreal));
342 // @TODO no handling of rank>1 allocation (no distributed GPU)
343
344 // check cpu memory allocation was successful
345 validateDiagonalOpAllocation(&op, env, __func__);
346
347 // allocate GPU memory
348 size_t arrSize = op.numElemsPerChunk * sizeof(qreal);
349 cudaMalloc(&(op.deviceOperator.real), arrSize);
350 cudaMalloc(&(op.deviceOperator.imag), arrSize);
351
352 // check gpu memory allocation was successful
353 validateDiagonalOpGPUAllocation(&op, env, __func__);
354
355 // initialise GPU memory to zero
356 cudaMemset(op.deviceOperator.real, 0, arrSize);
357 cudaMemset(op.deviceOperator.imag, 0, arrSize);
358
359 return op;
360}

4070 int i = (r >> q) & 1;
4071 int j = (c >> q) & 1;
4072 int p = (int) pauliCodes[pInd++];
4073 int k = (p<<2) + (i<<1) + j;
4074 int pauliRe = pauliRealElems[k];
4075 int pauliIm = pauliImagElems[k];
4076
4077 // kron *= pauli
4078 int tmp = (pauliRe*kronRe) - (pauliIm*kronIm);
4079 kronIm = (pauliRe*kronIm) + (pauliIm*kronRe);
4080 kronRe = tmp;
4081 }
4082
4083 // elem = sum_t coeffs[t] pauliKronecker[r][c]
4084 elemRe += termCoeffs[t] * kronRe;
4085 elemIm += termCoeffs[t] * kronIm;
4086 }
4087
4088 // overwrite the density matrix entry
4089 qureg.deviceStateVec.real[n] = elemRe;
4090 qureg.deviceStateVec.imag[n] = elemIm;
4091}

118 {
119 /* inserted bit inds must strictly increase, so that their final indices are correct.
120 * in-lieu of sorting (avoided since no C++ variable-size arrays, and since we're already
121 * memory bottle-necked so overhead eats this slowdown), we find the next-smallest index each
122 * at each insert. recall every element of inds (a positive or zero number) is unique.
123 * This function won't appear in the CPU code, which can use C99 variable-size arrays and
124 * ought to make a sorted array before threading
125 */
126 int curMin = inds[0];
127 int prevMin = -1;

129
130 // find next min

136

138 prevMin = curMin;

140 if (inds[t] > curMin) {
141 curMin = inds[t];
142 break;
143 }
144 }

3875 break;
3876 }
3877 }
3878 if (found)
3879 break;
3880 }
3881
3882 // compute the phase (unless overriden)
3883 qreal phase = 0;
3884 if (i < numOverrides)
3885 phase = overridePhases[i];
3886 else {
3887 // compute norm related phases
3888 if (phaseFuncName == NORM || phaseFuncName == INVERSE_NORM ||
3889 phaseFuncName == SCALED_NORM || phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_NORM ||
3890 phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_SHIFTED_NORM) {
3891 qreal norm = 0;
3892 if (phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_SHIFTED_NORM) {
3893 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++) {
3894 qreal dif = phaseInds[r*stride+offset] - params[2+r];
3895 norm += dif*dif;
3896 }
3897 }
3898 else
3899 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++)
3900 norm += phaseInds[r*stride+offset]*phaseInds[r*stride+offset];
3901 norm = sqrt(norm);
3902
3903 if (phaseFuncName == NORM)
3904 phase = norm;
3905 else if (phaseFuncName == INVERSE_NORM)
3906 phase = (norm == 0.)? params[0] : 1/norm; // smallest non-zero norm is 1
3907 else if (phaseFuncName == SCALED_NORM)
3908 phase = params[0] * norm;
3909 else if (phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_NORM || phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_SHIFTED_NORM)
3910 phase = (norm <= REAL_EPS)? params[1] : params[0] / norm; // unless shifted closer to zero
3911 }
3912 // compute product related phases
3913 else if (phaseFuncName == PRODUCT || phaseFuncName == INVERSE_PRODUCT ||
3914 phaseFuncName == SCALED_PRODUCT || phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_PRODUCT) {
3915
3916 qreal prod = 1;
3917 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r++)
3918 prod *= phaseInds[r*stride+offset];
3919
3920 if (phaseFuncName == PRODUCT)
3921 phase = prod;
3922 else if (phaseFuncName == INVERSE_PRODUCT)
3923 phase = (prod == 0.)? params[0] : 1/prod; // smallest non-zero prod is +- 1
3924 else if (phaseFuncName == SCALED_PRODUCT)
3925 phase = params[0] * prod;
3926 else if (phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_PRODUCT)
3927 phase = (prod == 0.)? params[1] : params[0] / prod;
3928 }
3929 // compute Euclidean distance related phases
3930 else if (phaseFuncName == DISTANCE || phaseFuncName == INVERSE_DISTANCE ||
3931 phaseFuncName == SCALED_DISTANCE || phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_DISTANCE ||
3932 phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_SHIFTED_DISTANCE || phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_SHIFTED_WEIGHTED_DISTANCE) {
3933
3934 qreal dist = 0;
3935 if (phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_SHIFTED_DISTANCE) {
3936 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r+=2) {
3937 qreal dif = (phaseInds[r*stride+offset] - phaseInds[(r+1)*stride+offset] - params[2+r/2]);
3938 dist += dif*dif;
3939 }
3940 }
3941 else if (phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_SHIFTED_WEIGHTED_DISTANCE) {
3942 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r+=2) {
3943 qreal dif = (phaseInds[r*stride+offset] - phaseInds[(r+1)*stride+offset] - params[2+r+1]);
3944 dist += params[2+r] * dif*dif;
3945 }
3946 }
3947 else
3948 for (int r=0; r<numRegs; r+=2) {
3949 qreal dif = (phaseInds[(r+1)*stride+offset] - phaseInds[r*stride+offset]);
3950 dist += dif*dif;
3951 }
3952
3953 // if sqrt() arg would be negative, set it to divergence param
3954 if (dist < 0)
3955 dist = 0;
3956 dist = sqrt(dist);
3957
3958 if (phaseFuncName == DISTANCE)
3959 phase = dist;
3960 else if (phaseFuncName == INVERSE_DISTANCE)
3961 phase = (dist == 0.)? params[0] : 1/dist; // smallest non-zero dist is 1
3962 else if (phaseFuncName == SCALED_DISTANCE)
3963 phase = params[0] * dist;
3964 else if (phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_DISTANCE || phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_SHIFTED_DISTANCE || phaseFuncName == SCALED_INVERSE_SHIFTED_WEIGHTED_DISTANCE)
3965 phase = (dist <= REAL_EPS)? params[1] : params[0] / dist; // unless shifted closer
3966 }
3967 }
3968
3969
3970 // negate phase to conjugate operator
3971 if (conj)
3972 phase *= -1;
3973
3974 // modify amp to amp * exp(i phase)
3975 qreal c = cos(phase);
3976 qreal s = sin(phase);
3977 qreal re = qureg.deviceStateVec.real[index];
3978 qreal im = qureg.deviceStateVec.imag[index];
3979
3980 // = {re[amp] cos(phase) - im[amp] sin(phase)} + i {re[amp] sin(phase) + im[amp] cos(phase)}
3981 qureg.deviceStateVec.real[index] = re*c - im*s;
3982 qureg.deviceStateVec.imag[index] = re*s + im*c;
3983}

This calls swapQubitAmps only when it would involve a distributed communication; if the qubit chunks already fit in the node, it operates the unitary direct.

Note the order of q1 and q2 in the call to twoQubitUnitaryLocal is important.

refactor so that the 'swap back' isn't performed; instead the qubit locations are updated.

the double swap (q1,q2 to 0,1) may be possible simultaneously by a bespoke swap routine.
